Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Okay, so I need to help the user by creating a comprehensive event log from several ERP tables. Let me go through each table and see how to map the data.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: First, the Orders table has order IDs, order dates, customer info, etc. Each order should be a separate event. Since the case ID is order_id, each order will be its own event. I'll list each order, their date, and note any relevant attributes.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Next, the Order Lines table. Each line in an order has an item_id, quantity, item_picking_date, picker_id. These lines are part of the order, so they should be events linked to the order. I'll calculate the total quantity and maybe include the item_picking_date as the event date.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The Delivery table lists multiple deliveries per order. Each delivery has an order_id, dispatch date, arrival date, carrier, and note. These are separate events, linked to the order. I'll include each delivery as a separate event, noting when it arrived.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For the Invoice table, each invoice relates to an order. The invoice has an issue date, amount, and billing person. This is a straightforward event linked to the order.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The Payments table lists payments for invoices. Payment details include date, invoice, method, and reference. Each payment is a separate event, linked to the invoice and order.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - IND
Text: The Products table isnt essential, but maybe its useful for additional context. It provides item descriptions and categories, which could help in understanding the data better.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now, I'll link each event using case_id (order_id), activity name. For Order Lines and Delivery, the activity is Order Processing since they involve handling the order. For Invoice, its Invoice Processing. For Payments, its Payment Processing.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: I'll ensure the timestamps are corrected or included where necessary. For Order Lines and Delivery, the item_picking_date or delivery_arrival_date becomes the timestamp. For Payments, payment_date is the timestamp.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: I'll also note that the output requires events per order and include all relevant attributes. Missing data is noted with assumptions, like quantity for Order Lines. Finally, I'll structure the output as a Markdown table, making sure each row has the required columns and that timestamps are in chronological order.
